comments.commentBody:
Donald Seekins -- "half-baked imperialist adventures abroad (one of which Ms. Clinton heartily supported in 2003)"

True, and more. She actually herself did three more herself.

Libya was her project, "We came, we saw, he died." Th NYT explained in great detail how she was the one who did that, the "hawk" who pushed it through the Administration and our allies.

Syria's regime change started on her watch, run in country by the Ambassador she appointed who reported to her. It certainly got a lot worse after she left, but not only did she start it, she has consistently called to make it worse, with a no-fly zone and an occupied insurgent ("refugee") sanctuary inside Syria guarded by the forces of the US and NATO.

Ukraine, whatever one calls that project, was also hers. It was done while she was Sec of State, run by her own special assistant Sec Victoria Nuland, a buddy of Hillary appointed by Hillary and reporting to Hillary. Important assistance was by the Ambassador she also appointed, who also reported to her. The $5 billion used to do it per Nuland's brag was funneled through the State Dept run by Hillary.

She can't both brag of the important position she held, and claim that she in that position was not responsible for what was done in her name.

This is not just a matter of blame. She voted for it once, then did it three times, and urged each of them and Afghanistan too to be done bigger. We must expect as President she'd do what she has done so many times.

How could anyone possibly be "over-educated"?  When has education ever been a bad thing? Is the recognition of global warming an example of that phenomenon? Anyway, how does it feel to be supporting someone who receives (as opposed to "earns") millions of dollars per year from the company that bears his name but evidently does not pay a dime in income taxes?  Should we admire his (tax attorney's) business savvy or kick ourselves in the butt for being such suckers?

"Trump Lashes Out, Attacking Moderator and Pageant Winner"

Oh my goodness. Just look at that headline. Where else would one see such a a thing? On a newscast earlier today they even played a tape of a conversation between Trump and Howard Stern regarding the possible bowel movements of someone who was eating as much as the "Pageant Winner" allegedly ate.

The US is not provoking Russia or Iran. My hope is that Iranian-American relations will continue to improve with a long term goal of reestablishing formal diplomatic relations. In regards to Russia, Putin is the provocative one who invaded another country and took their land (Crimea). The EU, NATO, UN and US did nothing to stop this act of war upon another country. I'm thankful to not be in a war with Russia, but in no way is the US the one to blame as provoking.

What kind of person voted for W and Cheney? They LIED us into the Iraq War.

The W signed the agreement to remove all US troops from Iraq by December 31, 2011. But Republicans blame Obama for following the agreement he was given as a deal by W.

Put the blame where it belongs.

Once again Trump the blustering bully is lashing out because he continues to expose himself as an irresponsible unfit to lead oaf to millions of people around the world.  He's embarassed himself again and continues to blame everyone else for his arrogant nonsensical utterances.
Do not be sorry Reverend.
Why doesn't increased spending on infrastructure, education, non-polluting energy, etc. count as increased spending?

Al, how is that outside the scope of the debate?  Keep in mind, all those issues Lester Holt brought up to Trump, were public statements Trump made.  It seems quite acceptable for a moderator to question a candidate for public statements he made publicly.  There's no foul play in that.  And frankly as a voter, I'd like to see someone question him for his public statements.  That is what all good reporters should do.

Second-raters hoping for future jobs/sinecures in a GOP administration, duh. See: Chris Christie. Cruz still has hopes for running again and has to make nice/present a united front to get any future GOP cooperation.

If Donald Trump is unable to respond calmly and rationally to questions about topics like the "birther" lie, which he himself has promoted for many years and has made a central piece of his campaign, lord help us all if he ever has to face down a real threat to this nation.

And, by suggesting doing it, they did it!

It was considered by strategists to be a no-brainer bad idea. Ha.
Let's not forget Donald's own sterling record of infidelities, ad nauseum. If he opens that can of worms he's going to get hit very hard.

Classic Trump. He'll make Bill Clinton's infidelity a campaign issue, but won't acknowledge his own sexist behavior toward Alicia Machado, who by her account gained a "massive" 12 pounds during her tenure as Miss Universe.

How are either of these topics worthy of a Presidential campaign?
Blessed be the peacekeepers.

By the way, it also describes how eager the Iranians are for us to give them the excuse to welsh on the nuclear deal. They would immediately begin enriching fissile material again. This is why it was such a good deal.

And for anyone who doesn't know, that big money was theirs, we just returned it. These things are never as simple as outsiders would like them to be when they use them to deceive.
Any attempt to renegotiate debt and the US dollar would become confetti.  Living standards for most Americans would plummet.

We face stark economic danger with a sadistic exploiting bully in the White House. The New Yorker (9/26/16), describes how the transition team is already working to figure out how to destroy our country. Did you know he could, in addition to cancelling the Paris Climate and Iran deals, really start a nuclear war?

This vainglorious self-regarding idiot will ruin the economy, because this loser knows he's a winner.

"a Trump victory [among] top-ten risks .... Trump’s economic and trade policies would help trigger a protracted recession within 18 months. .... increase the risk of financial crises in emerging markets.”

"Trump’s trade plan could trigger a trade war that would put roughly 4 million Americans out of work, and cost the economy 3 million jobs that would have been created in Trump’s absence."

"a Trump victory is now generally regarded as “a major destabilizing development for financial markets ... If he ever even alludes to renegotiating the debt, we will have a downgrade of U.S. debt, and that event will cause a massive exodus of foreign investors from the U.S. Treasury market.” In 2011, when feuding in Congress delayed raising the debt limit, the stock market fell 17%. .... “The cornerstone of the right to raise sovereign debt is the willingness and ability of the government to service it ... markets have no patience for stupidity or ignorance.""

Please read this!
http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2016/09/26/president-trumps-first-term

You mean like over 75% of the American electorate after 9/11 and the 75% of the senate that voted on the Iraq resolution? The one George Bush sold to the public and senate on false pretenses ?! That one?
Get a grip.

DW quoting Clinton: “What kind of person would want to root for nine million families losing their homes?”

Answer: The kind of person who believes immigration laws should be enforced.
And thank God he did. Holt may have just saved our democracy from Trump.
Not answering a question does tend to provoke follow up questioning from a moderator.

if you are interested in foreign policy and have any knowledge at all of the history on your own continent, you would recognize that Trump is running his campaign on fascist rhetoric . He does not have "policies". He's a strong man. And he must be defeated.

Oh for heaven's sake. Numerous investigations by the REPUBLICANS in Congress have beaten the Benghazi tragedy into the ground without proving anything misdeeds by Clinton or the Obama administration. Grow up. Get a Life. Start focusing on things that are real.... Trump hires foreign workers, Trump does pay people who do contract work for him, Trump has many of his products made in China, Trump is part of a "School" that is in court for fraud. Trump says all those things are bad and are the fault of the administration. Trumps says they are bad but Trump does them. "That's called Business," he says. I guess they are not so bad wen they profit him.

There is an old saying about people in glass houses........
I've read he wasn't too bad as a teen.  He went off the rails later.
Yes - Nixon was intelligent.

According to the Donald he is not responsible for anything.  When caught abusing women, telling lies or not revealing his tax records it is always the other guy's falt for revealing it, never that he did it. he wants Hillary to take responsibility when she makes mistakes which she does, but when he is caught abusing a pageant winner it is her falt for gaining some weight or when he is called out for not paying his contractors he claims they did not do a good job despite the fact that he weaseled out by declaring bankruptcy.  Truman said, the buck stops here, by which he meant responsibility not the buck in Trump's wallet.
Indeed and judging by body language it seems that Hillary is quite distant from Bill. Keep him there Hillary.

Bill and Hillary Clinton have been married for many years.  How many middle aged couples who have been married for years make public displays of overdone affection?  They hugged each other.  They respect and love each other.  Enough.

Trump bringing up Bill Clinton's marital history may well backfire. Given
enough rope he may really hang himself by doing this. Whatever the reason Hilary decided to stay married. if Hilary is hopefully elected she will be the one in the Oval Office not Bill making the decisions and calling the shots. If Trump brings up Bill's "wandering" he will be going full tilt Nixon. I wonder then will Americans vote for the tabloid rag candidate Trump or the seasoned
intelligent steady hand Hilary? She has enough to throw back at him
including his charity organization and the infamous Trump University.
